kernfrasen: am lebendigen Leibe Glied um Glied vertrocknen
von den männlichen Neurosen heilen lassen
den Götzen des New Age nachlaufen
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS MOVEMENT WITH THE MARGINALIZED

cognitieve_implicaties: The priest has no agency or personal faith
The ritual is mechanical and impersonal
theologische_implicaties: Ex opere operato is reduced to a technical function
Loss of the 'living' spirit in liturgy
ethische_implicaties: Congregants become consumers of religious products
onbedoelde_consequenties: Devaluation of the objective validity of sacraments

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the source domain of modern technology to critique ancient ritualism.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: füttert sie mit Pappe und Klischees

cognitieve_implicaties: The church's teaching is indigestible and provides no life
theologische_implicaties: The Word of God is being replaced by human structures
onbedoelde_consequenties: Implies the hearer is a passive victim of 'feeding'

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Uses a visceral, physical sensation of eating something inedible to provoke disgust.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon consistently uses the 'Life vs. Death' meta-schema. All sub-metaphors (starvation, mechanical priests, dry bones, neuroses) serve the central question of Ezechiel: 'Why will you die?'

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The historical-political movement is blended with the prophetic vision to give the 'bones' (the marginalized) 'flesh' (political agency).

sterktes.beschrijving: Revitalizes the 'Body of Christ' metaphor by showing it 'withering' and 'falling off' due to 'neuroses'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Glied um Glied vertrocknen und abfallen

risicos.beschrijving: Ecclesiastical power structures are reduced to psychological 'neuroses', which might downplay systemic/theological arguments.
risicos.voorbeeld: euch von den männlichen Neurosen heilen zu lassen
risicos.potentiele_impact: The conflict is seen as a medical pathology rather than a theological debate.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A battlefield/valley of dry bones where a rigid institution is dying.
sub_worlds: The base communities in Latin America (world of life/hope)

deictic_shifts.naar_wereld: Slums of Colombia/Palace of Helder Camara
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates immediate empathy and concrete stakes.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By mapping God's perspective to the 'powerless' and 'women'.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Using Mt 23:9 and the image of the 'high guest' ignoring the poor.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: The Church as a 'Community of Equals'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly prophetic; aligns with the 'Lament' and 'Call to Repentance' liturgical movements.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'ORGANIC vs. MECHANICAL' and 'LIFE vs. DEATH' binaries. It successfully maps institutional rigidity to physical decay and spiritual starvation. The landscape is one of a 'dying body' that refuses the 'breath' (Ruach) of the marginalized.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Often used as a vague cliché.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Link the 'Spirit' more physically to the 'Ruach' (breath/wind) mentioned at the end.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Spirit as the actual oxygen for a suffocating institution.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Frame democracy as the 'circulatory system' that allows the Spirit to flow through all members.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If limbs 'fall off', the body is permanently mutilated.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize the 'resurrection' aspect of Ezechiel to show that even 'fallen' limbs can be restored.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To contrast the 'Palace' of the Archbishop with the 'Huts' of the poor and the 'Temple' of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of cognitive homiletics that uses embodied metaphors of hunger, deformity, and breath to make abstract institutional critique viscerally felt.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'poetic' imagery of dry bones, CMT reveals that these images function as a cognitive argument for the necessity of structural change.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher 're-wires' the hearer's mental map of the Church from a 'Hierarchy' to an 'Organism'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies the 'Pappe' (cardboard) metaphor as a crucial disruption of the 'Teaching is Food' schema, explaining why the hearer feels a sense of spiritual nausea.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Prophetic' persona, using the Ezechiel framework to authorize a harsh critique of contemporary power.
